website_summaries.verdict: Despite the occasional installation issue, buyers love this tweeter set for its clear sound, particularly with the volume cranked up.
pros: Very clear highs, with great vocal clarity
Has a variety of mounting options for easy installation
Not as harsh at higher volumes as other models
cons: Despite the options right out of the box, some installation issues with select vehicles have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Sound much better than Kickers did.
customer_reviews.text: Put these in the front doors of my 2015 Ram 1500 5.7L with crew cab . originally replaced factory speakers with Kicker DSC650, but after a month of listening wasnt entirely happy. These however are it. They have it all, great bass punch and great detail with out being fatiguing in the highs at all, Nice and smooth revealing treble. they mate well with the Alpine SPR69 6x9's in the rear doors. I will be buying more Infinity Car audio in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Mako

customer_reviews.title: Great speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Great for factory replacement. Easiest install I've ever had. I installed the 3.5's in the dash and 6.5's in all four doors. No amp and these sound awesome!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Direct replacement for Charger/Challenger 3.5" dash speakers! Use Metra 72-7902 harnesses!
customer_reviews.text: These Infinity speakers are a direct replacement for the factory 3.5" alpine dash speakers. I have a 2019 Charger 392 scatpack with factory 6 speaker alpine system and these have much better range and overall clarity than stock! Make sure you purchase a pair of Metra harness 72-7902 for the dash speakers. Makes these plug and play on Charger and Challenger.
customer_reviews.author: Jaunty

customer_reviews.title: Small -- sound fine
customer_reviews.text: These are tiny speakers. They have clear highs, iffy mids, no mid-bass, and absolutely no deep bass (they even come with frequency-killers to prevent the signal from getting there). Speakers below 4" are only good for vocals and high treble. These work fine for that. At the price point, they are okay. I've certainly heard better Infinity car audio speakers, but those were all larger, so the comparison isn't fair.
customer_reviews.author: ihsan

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great value
customer_reviews.text: This made a significant improvement as replacement speakers for my Jeep Wrangler stock speakers in the sound bar. I first went with another set of speakers (JBL components) and was very disappointed with the sound quality, not to mention the installation because I had to get a crossover on the line. These were the 2nd pair I tried and was very impressed right away with the quality of the sound and the volume. The bass was not too punchy and sounded just write. The tweeter was very clear and had good volume too. Overall, I am very pleased with these as replacement speakers. Make sure you order the adapter to the factory harness to make installation even easier.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar C

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for Honda factory speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for 2012 Honda pilot exl without navigation. Honda seems to think last about sound quality with the entry level stereo option. I put these components in the front with the factory stereo and they greatly improved the sound. There is clarity now where it didn't used to be. I should have done this upgrade years ago. The crossovers are a little big, but they did fit on the door under the panel inside the car easily. I am sure these would sound even better with more power, but to me they are a huge improvement over Honda stock speakers.
customer_reviews.author: NCSi

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Good without amplifier not a lot of bass.
customer_reviews.text: Like everyone else says, the lows aren’t that strong. The highs and mids are really good though and if paired with subs they will be just fine. They are shallow fit so the fact that they fit where stock speakers fit and sound a world better is reason to get these. I’d get an amplifier and bigger speakers but didn’t feel like cutting up the shallow space allotted for factory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation plus GREAT SOUND!!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from Infinity speakers is legendary, and this set meets expectations. I've used Infinity speakers since the original Kappa series came out, many moons ago. I sold the car with my first set many years ago, and have since installed Kappa and Reference in both my Explorer, as well as my 560SL...dash and parcel shelf. The sound quality is phenomenal. I know the price is a little up there compared to Kenwood or Pioneer, but what you get for your money far exceeds the amount you spend.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Linville

customer_reviews.title: Non-fatiguing quality sound
customer_reviews.text: Replaced identical sized Kicker coaxial speakers on a homemade Bluetooth boom box with these Infinity speakers and the sound was transformed. Improved midrange and superb, natural highs. The lows seem as advertised and may get stronger after the speakers break in, but this box has a long throw dedicated subwoofer driven by 100 watts so that really isn’t a concern. These speakers have very natural sound, the kind you can crank up and still listen to for hours. Just make sure you pair them with driver(s) that work below 65Hz or you may feel they lack real bass, as should be expected on shallow, 6 1/2 inch speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Levine

customer_reviews.title: Sound amazing.
customer_reviews.text: They have amazing bass and very clean vocals. They sound amazing. The build quality is great. I will only use Infinity and JBL for my car speakers. Harmon Kardon makes both brands. They blow all the rest away including JL Audio and Focal, Yes I went there! Subs are a different story and I don't use subs because the bass output is plenty with these. Don't take my word for it. Go to a car audio store and listen for your self. Get a good head unit with decent RMS and sound quality like Pioneer, Alpine, Kenwood, etc...
customer_reviews.author: Frank Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker for adding Highs and Mids to your setup!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to upgrade my rear door speakers in my Alpine audio on my RAM truck. The Alpine system is good, but lacked highs & mids in the rear. These helped bring that to the soundstage. A bit of advice, don't put them in the front doors. They will over power all bass and make your system have an overpowered vocal note.
customer_reviews.author: James F

customer_reviews.title: Love these speakers!
customer_reviews.text: Tweeters are awesome. Added so much more clean treble to the front of the vehicle. I have them crossed over and running in parallel with the existing front coax speakers. I am pushing them with ~100W ea from an Alpine PDX-V9 amp. I mounted them flush in the A-pillar of the front doors. Perfect spot for pushing the sound stage up and forward. All I can say is they are AMAZING. Great job Infinity. What a bargain at $49 too.
customer_reviews.author: Jabiner

customer_reviews.title: Great Speakers.
customer_reviews.text: These are a huge improvement in my 2005 CRV. I'm a sound engineer and a bit of an audiophile. If these were $300 I might be a little more critical. For $60, they are fantastic. They were not a direct fit in my CRV, but nothing will be. Tge have a messed up shape for a speaker hole I cut a piece of 1/2" plywood to fit it out and they worked great. They sound much much better than the stock speakers. I'm not running an amp either.
customer_reviews.author: CutterNorth

customer_reviews.title: (2) 6 1/2 and (2) 4x6 speakers in 1995 GMC Sierra K1500
customer_reviews.text: Overall, pretty good. Had them in for a few days and I'm happy with the sound quality with the stock AM/FM Tape drive unit that originally came with the truck. Easy install ! These are an upgrade from the original speakers. Installed the rear 4x6 speakers. I'd say these are worth the money and they are a perfect fit !
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love em'
customer_reviews.text: Installed these in a 1997 4runner today, they sound much better than the MTX component set they are replacing. The supplied speaker ring fit the stock opening, I just had to cut all the extra ears off to clear the door panels. The tweeters were installed with some strong glue to the factory metal tweeter stands, because the supplied tweeter mounts didnt work for my application. Overall I'm impressed by the sound and clarity of these speakers, they handle highs mids and enough low before my sub handles the rest.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Excelent replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I put these in my 2018 jeep renegade latitude. I could not stand the stock audio it had a very brittle treble sound but excellent bass. I replaced the dashboard speakers with these and set the balance slightly towards the back. Now my music sounds incredible and blows the stock setup out of the water. I'd even say these are better than the factory beats upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel johnson

customer_reviews.title: No speaker leads included.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best 3.5" coax speaker on the market. I installed them on a 2019 ram 1500 with alpine system. There is a noticeable difference in clarity from the stock speakers. For the rear speaker locations I had to make a minor modification to make them fit. Shame on infinity for not providing short speaker leads like pioneer does. You will need a separate 7" speaker wire for each speaker to connect to factory speaker harness. The positive wire on all factory speaker harnesses is grey with lighter colored tracer than the other. Example: grey/ light green and grey dark green. Grey /light green is the positive wire.
customer_reviews.author: Lineman41

customer_reviews.title: One is louder than the other?
customer_reviews.text: These tweeters are very efficient and come with a bass bypass which keeps them distorting. They sound a little tinny to me but it could be the stock amp that I’m using. My main concern is it really seems like the right channel speaker is noticeably louder than the left channel speaker. I have had to adjust the pan to the left to get what I consider a good balance. I asked a couple of friends to listen to make sure it wasn’t just me and they all agreed it’s true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I DONT GET THESE HIGH REVIEWS
customer_reviews.text: I AM REPLACING FACTORY JBL ON MY PRIUS AND THESE INFINTY SPEAKERS ARE SOUNDING TERRIBLE CANNOT HANDLE ANY BASS AT ALL!!!! TOOK TOO LONG TO INSTALL AND WENT PAST RETURN DATE, I HAD TO TAKE THEM OUT , AND TAKE A LOSS ON THIS ONE :-(
customer_reviews.author: scorpionx71

customer_reviews.title: 2016 Ram 1500 w/ 6 speaker system
customer_reviews.text: Great clarity, wonderful Highs and Mids out of these speakers. Installed in the dash of a Ram 1500 with the 6 speaker, Uconnect 5". The Rams have a High-pass filter for the front door speakers, so keep that in mind when choosing your 3.5" and your 6x9s. I usually like all one brand but since I was on a budget install I was looking for best bang for my buck. I installed these in the dash(high/mid), MTX Terminator69 in the front doors (low/mid), and Pioneer 6x9s in the rear doors (full range) and I couldn't be happier. Great clarity with a little bit of bump. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: These replaced factory speakers in a 20 year old Subaru and the clarity is now somewhat better but it seems these speakers are missing what I can only describe as richness in sound. This is being fed by a Kenwood head unit and I have the exact same head unit in a 30 year old pickup truck. The truck has Pioneer speakers that came with the truck but are probably not the factory speakers. The Pioneer speakers sound much richer than these Infinities. Maybe the Pioneers are high end expensive speakers but I somehow doubt that. These Infinities are ok but nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: Wendover

customer_reviews.title: 2017 ram alpine upgrade
customer_reviews.text: 2017 ram with alpine u connect. I made the mistakes of buying the kickers and pioneer sub to try and get a better sound. After realizing the upgrade was not an upgrade at all I went ahead and bought these along with the separate 6x9 mid bass speakers. I replaced all three dash and the two front door speakers and put the factory sub back in. What a difference! It’s not a audiophile set up by any stretch but a nice noticeable improvement.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Wish my home audio sounded this good.
customer_reviews.text: I installed these in my Miata headrests. No need for the base cancelling caps. They sound clear and crisp and fill the car with the ranges it was missing. With the front Infinity 6.5s you are completely surrounded in music. There are two 6.5, and four 3.5 and together they are the best audio speakers I have purchased. Great speakers!
customer_reviews.author: thesteelguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade for Ram Dash Speakers
customer_reviews.text: These speakers were a great upgrade for the dash speakers in my 2018 ram with the alpine system. These should work on any 2013-2018 ram with the alpine system and possibly other years as well. They didn't come with any connectors or anything, so I had to solder the factory connector from the original speakers onto these as amazon doesn't carry the appropriate adapters (crutchfield does), but once that was done they work great and really open up the sound and don't distort at all like the factory speakers. I didn't really think the factory ones distorted much at all, but it's clear after installing these that they did/do. I recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Brothers

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love them....
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love these, the packaging was very nice, they look really really nice, but the sound quality was honestly worse than the stock non bose speakers in my silverado....
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Luxury car or better sound for less than $100
customer_reviews.text: High end sound for a fraction of the cost. These things pump out music like no other. Matched them with the Infinity reference 5.25 component Speakers and the small Alpine 4 channel amp and my 19 year old car sounds better than modern luxury cars do!
customer_reviews.author: DIY Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: High's too hi. overall ok speakers tho
customer_reviews.text: Cannot seem to get the "hi"/Treble turned down. Handle bass ok, and sound very clear, Fit fine, and I am using a 200w stereo amp dedicated to these alone from stock head unit using "Hi Level Inputs" on the amp with gain almost all the way down, only complaint is the hi's are overpowering.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W. PA

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value and the sound quality is SUPERB!
customer_reviews.text: These speakers ROCK!!! The sound quality is excellent! The bottom end is solid and punchy, and the mids and highs are buttery smooth. The install was pretty rough though. I had to do a temporary installation until I can get the proper adapters to fit my vehicle. Compared to what we could get in the 70's, these are an exceptional value and offer up superb sound!
customer_reviews.author: Hook 'em DanO

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality
customer_reviews.text: I don't have 50 hours on these yet but they do sound nice. No thumping bass but you do hear the bass. I think it gives a nice full sound. If you want thumping get a sub and amp. No regrets in buying these, they don't sound tinny, they don't sound muddy. They sound good to my ears for what its worth. Definitely a worthwhile upgrade for low $$
customer_reviews.author: jackstraw

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my dash speakers in my 2018 Ram 1500 w/ Alpine system with these Infinities. The difference is night and day. The highs are so much more clear it seems louder even though no more power was added. I have the JL Audio Stealth Box w/ 10" sub in place of the Alpine 8" sub under the back seat. The truck was a little "bass heavy" for my taste before adding these speakers. Not now!! I listen to all genres of music and I'm very happy. Install took maybe 20 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Nick B.

customer_reviews.title: Good speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am quite happy with these speakers. I have them in the front doors of my car. I am no audiophile but do appreciate the clarity of sound and these are great for the price. I have the tweeters at the lower dB setting (dont' want harsher high frequency) and it works for me. I can hear the symbols clearly. I have these on Precision Power ICE1000.4 Black Ice. The sound is very clean and balanced for my liking. Very good speakers for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ultrajedi

customer_reviews.title: Moderately price quality speakers
customer_reviews.text: Reference series is the less expensive model for a reason. They are good speakers for the money. I’m using an Alpine power pack 45x4 to push them. Pairs pretty well with clean highs and solid bass down to about 50hz. Install in a Silverado front door requires an install adapter for the window to clear. Overall pleased but now blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound!
customer_reviews.text: These were a direct replacement for the stock speakers in my 2016 Challenger and the sound difference is astonishing. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: KenTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: G35 Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Very Fine upgrade for my G35 with a Bose head unit. Loved the Infinity's I put into my Impala SS ('96) and got GREAT results with these in my G35. The original Bose speakers were paper cones and no tweeters. These are fiber, coax and sound fantastic! If you are upgrading a G35 you WILL need spacers.
customer_reviews.author: WinterArcher

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great loud 6x9's ring instructions are a little confusing. The tweeters are loud but you can select db level with tiny button on them👍 using with amp 75w RMS sound outstanding front door speakers
customer_reviews.author: Hoss

customer_reviews.title: ... the back doors of my car and they sound like crap. Infinity markets these as a great choice ...
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this in the back doors of my car and they sound like crap. Infinity markets these as a great choice to replace factory speakers...wrong I am going to give these a couple of weeks and I hope they sounds better once they are broken in.
customer_reviews.author: txERK

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement
customer_reviews.text: I powered these speakers with an amp in my 2019 tundra. Anyone who is in my truck tells me that the sound quality is so nice and clean. I was looking for a nice set of speakers that would not break the bank but also not sacrificing sound quality for a cheaper set. I am really happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: gregb287

customer_reviews.title: Not much Bass
customer_reviews.text: purchased these based on bass response reviews. Disappointed. Not nearly the bass of the original speaker. Will most likely have to replace again with better quality. They're good for what they are, just not what I'm looking for. Then again I have separate tweeters so there's simply too much high freq and not enough bass for my taste
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Good Value for Components
customer_reviews.text: I run these 6x9's on a Rockford Fosgate "power1000 25 to life" amp. Unfortunately the first set only lasted for 13 months, on 75 watts of RMS power. Their RMS rating is 125 watts, but I guess they are over-rated by 50 watts, the left crossover had smoked and burnt out. They are cheap, so maybe just buy them for their low price and see if your amp doesn't ruin them.
customer_reviews.author: Drehkraft1

customer_reviews.title: best money i spent on speakers !!!
customer_reviews.text: i have a 99 Tahoe and the search for speakers has been exhausting. After a few poor choices i landed on these and they fit the back door like a charm.The sound quality is phenomenal and if i wanted to use them on the front door the adaptor plate needed came with the new speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen d.

product_meta.title: Infinity REF-275tx 135W Reference Series Edge-Driven Textile Car Tweeters, 3/4"
product_meta.description: Style:3/4" TweetersInfinity REF-275tx 135W Reference Series Edge-Driven Textile Car Tweeters, 3/4"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,181 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: A Pair Of Tweeters And Standard Accessories
